results.adx_keywords: Discrimination;Health Insurance and Managed Care;United States Politics and Government;Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010);Transgender and Transsexuals;Trump, Donald J;Human Rights Campaign;Health and Human Services Department
results.byline: By Margot Sanger-Katz and Noah Weiland
results.title: Trump Administration Erases Transgender Civil Rights Protections in Health Care
results.abstract: A rule finalized on Friday by the Department of Health and Human Services means that the federal government no longer recognizes gender identity as an avenue for sex discrimination in health care.
des_facet: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

media.caption: An empty hallway filled with gurneys at a hospital in Queens. The new rule will erase protections for transgender patients against discrimination in the health care sector.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Commencement Speeches;Trump, Donald J;United States Military Academy
results.title: Trump’s Halting Walk Down Ramp Raises New Health Questions
results.abstract: The president also appeared to have trouble raising a glass of water to his mouth during a speech at West Point a day before he turned 74, the oldest a president has been in his first term.

results.adx_keywords: Discrimination;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Transgender and Transsexuals;Civil Rights and Liberties;Decisions and Verdicts;Law and Legislation;Gorsuch, Neil M;Alito, Samuel A Jr;Stephens, Aimee;Bostock, Gerald;Zarda, Donald (1970-2014);Supreme Court (US);Equal Employment Opportunity Commission;RG & GR Harris Funeral Homes Inc
results.title: Civil Rights Law Protects Gay and Transgender Workers, Supreme Court Rules
results.abstract: The court said the language of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, which prohibits sex discrimination, applies to discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.
org_facet: RG & GR Harris Funeral Homes Inc

media.caption: Tiffany Munroe on Sunday in Brooklyn during a rally to call attention to violence against transgender people of color.
media.copyright: Demetrius Freeman for The New York Times

results.byline: By Malachy Browne, Christina Kelso and Barbara Marcolini
results.title: How Rayshard Brooks Was Fatally Shot by the Atlanta Police
results.abstract: One officer has been fired and another placed on administrative duty. A Times video analysis shows the sequence of events leading to the fatal shooting.

results.adx_keywords: Immigration and Emigration;Illegal Immigration;Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals;Courts and the Judiciary;Decisions and Verdicts;Trump, Donald J;Supreme Court (US);Homeland Security Department;Immigration and Customs Enforcement (US)
results.byline: By Adam Liptak and Michael D. Shear
results.title: Trump Can’t Immediately End DACA, Supreme Court Rules
results.abstract: The program, Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, protects people brought to the United States as children by shielding them from deportation and letting them work.

results.adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020);Black Lives Matter Movement;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Police Reform;United States
results.title: Yes, We Mean Literally Abolish the Police
results.abstract: Because reform won’t happen.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Books and Literature;Tax Evasion;Trump, Donald J;Trump, Mary L;New York Times
results.byline: By Neil Vigdor and Alexandra Alter
results.title: Trump’s Niece to Publish Book With ‘Harrowing’ Revelations
results.abstract: Mary Trump will say that she was a source of The New York Times’s coverage of the president’s tax returns. The Times declined to comment on the claim.

media.caption: President Trump walking off Air Force One at Joint Base Andrews, Md., on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;United States Politics and Government;United States International Relations;Impeachment;Trump-Ukraine Whistle-Blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Bolton, John R;Trump, Donald J
results.title: Bolton Says Trump Impeachment Inquiry Missed Other Troubling Episodes
results.abstract: In his new book, John R. Bolton, the former national security adviser, describes instances when the president sought to halt criminal inquiries. He also says President Trump’s loyalists mocked him behind his back.
des_facet: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-Blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry

media.caption: John R. Bolton was President Trump’s national security adviser for 17 months. Mr. Trump asked if Finland was part of Russia, Mr. Bolton wrote in his new book.

results.adx_keywords: Folk Music;Pop and Rock Music;Dylan, Bob
results.title: Bob Dylan Has a Lot on His Mind
results.abstract: In a rare interview, the Nobel Prize winner discusses mortality, drawing inspiration from the past, and his new album, “Rough and Rowdy Ways.”

media.caption: Bob Dylan’s “Rough and Rowdy Ways” is his first album of original songs since 2012.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Black People;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;George Floyd Protests (2020);Brooks, Rayshard (d 2020);Rolfe, Garrett (Atlanta, Ga, Police Officer);Brosnan, Devin (Atlanta, Ga, Police Officer);Shields, Erika (Atlanta, Ga, Police Chief);Atlanta (Ga)
results.byline: By Richard Fausset, Johnny Diaz and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
results.title: Atlanta Police Chief Resigns After Officer Shoots and Kills a Black Man
results.abstract: Rayshard Brooks had fallen asleep in his vehicle at a Wendy’s drive-through. He was shot after grabbing a Taser from an officer, the authorities said, prompting fresh unrest in the city.

media.caption: Protesters confronted police officers outside the Wendy’s restaurant in Atlanta where Rayshard Brooks was shot and killed in the parking lot.
media.copyright: Joshua Rashaad McFadden for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Advertising and Marketing;News and News Media;Television;George Floyd Protests (2020);Black Lives Matter Movement;Carlson, Tucker;Fox News Channel;Papa Johns International Inc;T-Mobile US Inc;Walt Disney Company
results.title: Fox News Host Tucker Carlson Loses More Advertisers
results.abstract: Disney, Papa John’s, Poshmark and T-Mobile backed away from “Tucker Carlson Tonight” after the host’s comments about Black Lives Matter protests.

media.caption: Advertiser disavowals of Tucker Carlson’s show, “Tucker Carlson Tonight,” have gained momentum.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV)
results.title: Pence Tells Governors to Repeat Misleading Claim on Outbreaks
results.abstract: Cash-starved states are forced to make massive job cuts. Reopenings for some restaurants and bars are short-lived amid new infections.

media.caption: Vice President Mike Pence at the White House on Monday.

results.title: How 2 Lives Collided in Central Park, Rattling the Nation
results.abstract: The inside story of the black birder and the white woman who called the police on him. Their encounter stirred wrenching conversations about racism and white privilege.

media.copyright: Brittainy Newman/The New York Times; Alison Faircloth

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;George Floyd Protests (2020);Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Annie Karni
results.title: Does Trump Want to Fight for a Second Term? His Self-Sabotage Worries Aides
results.abstract: Advisers and allies say the president’s repeated acts of self-destruction have significantly damaged his re-election prospects, and yet he appears mostly unable, or unwilling, to curtail them.

media.caption: President Trump has told advisers that no matter what he does, he cannot get “good” stories from the news media, people familiar with the conversations say.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV)
results.title: Honduran President Tests Positive
results.abstract: Scientists at the University of Oxford say they have identified a drug that can reduce coronavirus-related deaths. The virus flares in Beijing. Officials in Tulsa, Okla., worry that President Trump’s planned rally could cause a spike.

media.caption: President Juan Orlando Hernández of Honduras, center, addressing the the nation on the pandemic from the presidential palace in Tegucigalpa last month.
media.copyright: Honduran Presidency, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Antifa Movement (US);Holocaust and the Nazi Era;Presidential Election of 2020;Political Advertising;Social Media;Symbols;Trump, Donald J;Facebook Inc
results.title: Facebook Removes Trump Ads Displaying Symbol Used by Nazis
results.abstract: Nazis used a red triangle to classify political prisoners during World War II. The Trump campaign said the red triangle in its Facebook ads was associated with antifa, a claim experts rejected.

media.caption: Facebook said it removed the Trump campaign’s ads for “violating our policy against organized hate.”

results.adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020);Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Television
results.title: The Protests Come for ‘Paw Patrol’
results.abstract: A backlash is mounting against depictions of “good cops,” on television and in the street.

media.caption: Chase is on the case in “Paw Patrol,” but as protests against racist police violence reach their third week, criticism of fictional cops is growing, too.

results.adx_keywords: Black People;George Floyd Protests (2020);Black Lives Matter Movement;Slavery (Historical);Emancipation Proclamation (1863);United States Politics and Government;Juneteenth;Trump, Donald J;Galveston (Tex);Tulsa (Okla)
results.title: So You Want to Learn About Juneteenth?
results.abstract: On June 19, 1865, enslaved African-Americans in Galveston, Texas, were told they were free. Now, 155 years later, people in cities and towns across the U.S. continue to mark the occasion with celebrations.

media.caption: A Juneteenth parade in Flint, Mich., in 2018.
media.copyright: Jake May/The Flint Journal, via Associated Press

results.title: Flushing the Toilet May Fling Coronavirus Aerosols All Over
results.abstract: A new study shows how turbulence from a toilet bowl can create a large plume that is potentially infectious to a bathroom’s next visitor.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus Reopenings;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Quarantines;Teachers and School Employees;Education;Day Care Centers;Children and Childhood;Coronavirus Risks and Safety Concerns
results.byline: By Claire Cain Miller and Margot Sanger-Katz
results.title: How 132 Epidemiologists Are Deciding When to Send Their Children to School
results.abstract: “This is the dreaded question,” say experts struggling to weigh virus risks and uncertainty against family well-being.

media.caption: At a pre-K graduation ceremony in Jersey City, N.J., this week. Some schools are allowed to open if they take precautions like dividing students into small groups and requiring masks.
